longDescription:
Prerequisites for creating a cluster:
* a [service principal](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/develop/app-objects-and-service-principals) capable of creating clusters, for example with rights on the resource group
* a service principal (can be the same) for the cluster nodes, with the [necessary rights](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/kubernetes-service-principal)
* a subnet of a [virtual net](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/virtual-networks-overview) to put the cluster nodes in. The virtual net:
  * must have access to the machine running DSS (either the same VNet, or using peering)
  * belong to the resource group used to put the cluster in

For auto-scaling, activate Virtual Machine Scale Sets as described [in the doc](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/aks/cluster-autoscaler)

params.name: resourceGroup
params.label: Resource group
params.description: If left empty, same as current VM

params.name: location
params.label: Location
params.description: Region in which to create the cluster
If left empty, same as current VM

params.name: clusterServicePrincipal
params.label: Identity assumed by nodes
params.description: Service principal used by the cluster's nodes (if different from the connection)

params.name: serviceCIDR
params.label: Service CIDR
params.description: IP range for services in the cluster (cannot overlap the IP range of the pools' subnets)

params.name: dnsServiceIP
params.label: DNS IP
params.description: IP in the service IP range to use for the DNS server

params.name: nodePools
params.label: Node pools
params.description: Node pools to create in the cluster
